summary: This is an investigative memo outlining Jeffrey Epstein's status as a registered sex offender and potential violations of International Megan's Law travel reporting requirements. It provides detailed recommendations for investigation, including obtaining travel records, subpoenaing his companies, and identifying key individuals in his inner circle, potential witnesses, and victims. The memo categorizes individuals by their expected level of cooperation with law enforcement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Registered Sex Offender / Subject of Investigation
persons.context: The central subject of the memo, identified as a Tier 3 registered sex offender. The investigation focuses on his potential non-compliance with international travel reporting laws under SORNA and International Megan's Law.

events.title: International Megan's Law Enacted
events.description: The President signed into law the 'International Megan's Law to Prevent Child Exploitation and Other Sexual Crimes Through Advanced Notification of Traveling Sex Offenders,' which imposes new travel reporting requirements on registered sex offenders.

locations: 116 East 65th Street, New York, NY (implied from company name)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is a Tier 3 registered sex offender subject to SORNA and International Megan's Law travel reporting requirements, and the memo asserts there is reason to believe he has not complied with these laws.

The memo details a specific investigative plan: obtain Epstein's travel reports, FAA flight info for his planes (Gulfstream N909JE, Boeing N908JE, Cessna N908GM), passport data on passengers, and records from the travel agency 'Shopper's Travel' used to purchase tickets for females.

Epstein's numerous companies (C.O.U.Q. Foundation, East Broadway Partners LLC, etc.) are all represented by a single attorney, Darren Indyke, and are recommended for subpoena as they lack Fifth Amendment protection.

The document categorizes over two dozen individuals associated with Epstein into groups: his 'Inner Circle' (split into those who may cooperate and those who will remain loyal), individuals who engaged in massages with girls, New York witnesses with knowledge of crimes, and high-profile political connections.

A key operational detail is that all Epstein employees, past and present, signed confidentiality agreements requiring them to contact New York attorney Richard Kahn if ever approached by law enforcement.
